column4: how can I completely remove gnome? I tried apt-get autoremove ubuntu-desktop gnome gnome-core, but there are still atleast 90 appliation gnome-* which are installed...
you could just not start the kdm/gdm service...
yes, that's what I did 2 hours ago, but they are still consuming space....
fire up the package manger and start removing stuff I guess...
excuse me.... I am not into any UI, and using aptitude's ui would be headache, autoremove should have removed them, shouldn't it?
most likely not.. depoedns on how they got installed.
and what exactly did you do to try to remove them?
as said before apt-get autoremove ubuntu-desktop which is also the way recommend on the link bazhang gave

from what i recall thats just a meta-package.. if it had been installed with appitude, then aptitude  remove  ubuntu-desktop  might of gotten rid of it.. but ive never really tried.. Just heard of others trying to clean the stuff out, and failing
thats an issue  with using meta-packages I guess.
yes, it's a meta package, but the way to uninstall it is recommended on ubuntu community docs...
yownanymousi am programing python and sick of gedit and vi..
yes. its gui. and has good programing support
i use it for xml editing mainly
geany is like the coolest thing after ubuntu I ever saw... so light yet powerful
it has a windows port also. :)
